para.dtcname: Fuel System Leak Detected - Large Leak

content5.ptxt: The fuel pressure sensor mounted on the common rail assembly converts the fuel pressure inside the common rail assembly into an electrical signal and outputs the signal to the ECM. The ECM controls the fuel supply pump assembly in order to maintain the fuel pressure inside the common rail assembly at a target pressure calculated by the ECM. Refer to System Description (Click here ).

item.ptxt: If the drop in the internal fuel pressure is large when injecting fuel, the ECM interprets this as a fault and stores P0093.
If P0093 is present, refer to "Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) Table for Common Rail System" (Click here ).

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Fuel System Leak Detected - Large Leak

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Fuel pressure drop before and after the fuel injection is larger than the threshold a certain number of times (0.2 seconds or more).

item.ptxt: Fuel line between fuel supply pump and common rail assembly
Fuel line between common rail assembly and each fuel injector
Suction control valve (fuel supply pump assembly)
Fuel injector
Pressure discharge valve (common rail assembly)
Fuel pressure sensor (common rail assembly)
Crankshaft position sensor
Fuel filter element assembly
Open or short in fuel injector circuit
No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (P062D, P062E stored simultaneously)
ECM
Common Rail Pressure
Target Common Rail Pressure

atten4.ptxt: When DTC P0093 is set, check the internal fuel pressure of the common rail by entering the following menus on the GTS: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Common Rail Pressure.

entry.ptxt: After idling for 60 seconds, run the engine at 2500 rpm for 30 seconds.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it. (*A)
Rev the engine to 3000 rpm and fully release the accelerator pedal immediately after the engine reaches 3000 rpm. (*B)

content5.ptxt: This DTC indicates that fuel leaks exist in high pressure areas in the common rail system. The ECM constantly monitors the internal fuel pressure of the common rail assembly after the engine is started. The ECM stores this DTC if the drop in the internal fuel pressure is large when injecting fuel.
In the common rail system, high-pressure fuel is always supplied to the high-pressure areas including the fuel supply pump assembly, common rail assembly, injector assemblies and piping.
The ECM adjusts the suction control valve opening angle to obtain the target internal fuel pressure.

If this DTC is stored, the ECM enters fail-safe mode. In fail-safe mode, both fuel injection and fuel supply pump assembly operation are suspended, and then the engine is stopped. Before the engine is stopped, the ECM permits the vehicle to be driven for 1 minute. The ECM continues operating in fail-safe mode until the engine switch is turned off.

item.ptxt: Soon after starting the engine, visually check for fuel leaks in the fuel line.
After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (Click here ) and initialization (Click here ).
After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration (Click here ).

atten4.ptxt: Read freeze frame data using the GTS. Freeze frame data records the engine condition when malfunctions are detected. When troubleshooting, freeze frame data can help determine if the vehicle was moving or stationary, if the engine was warmed up or not, and other data from the time the malfunction occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR FUEL LEAKS (IN HIGH-PRESSURE AREAS)

test1.ptxt: Before starting the engine, visually check for fuel leaks from the fuel supply pump assembly, fuel injector, common rail assembly, and the fuel pipes in high-pressure areas.

specitem.ptxt: No fuel leaks in high-pressure areas.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR ANY OTHER DTCS OUTPUT (IN ADDITION TO DTC P0093) AND RECORD STORED DTC AND FREEZE FRAME DATA (PROCEDURE 2)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the DTCs and freeze frame data.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

entry.ptxt: P0093 and "P0190, P0192 and/or P0193" are output
P0093 and "P0335 and/or P0339" are output

action.actiontitle: GO TO DTC CHART (CRANKSHAFT POSITION SENSOR CIRCUIT)
GO TO FUEL PRESSURE SENSOR CIRCUIT

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FUEL RECEIVER GAUGE (AMOUNT OF FUEL)

test1.ptxt: Check if the fuel level is low.

entry.ptxt: The indicator (fuel warning light) is illuminated
The indicator (fuel warning light) is not illuminated

testgrp.testtitle: ADD FUEL

test1.ptxt: Add fuel.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WHETHER DTC OUTPUT RECURS (DTC P0093)

test1.ptxt: Using the hand pump mounted on the fuel filter cap, bleed the air from the fuel system. Continue pumping until the pump resistance increases.

item.ptxt: Hand pump pumping speed: Max. 2 strokes/sec.
The hand pump must be pushed with a full stroke during pumping.
When the fuel pressure at the supply pump inlet port reaches a saturated pressure, the hand pump resistance increases.
If pumping is interrupted during the air bleeding process, fuel in the fuel line may return to the fuel tank. Continue pumping until the hand pump resistance increases.

If the hand pump resistance does not increase despite consecutively pumping 200 times or more, there may be a fuel leak between the fuel tank and fuel filter element sub-assembly, the hand pump may be malfunctioning, or the vehicle may have run out of fuel.
If a large amount of air remains inside the fuel system, the common rail pressure does not rise to the pressure range necessary for normal use, and the engine cannot be started.

test1.ptxt: Start the engine.

item.ptxt: Even if air bleeding completes with the priming pump, the vehicle may take 10 seconds or more to start.
Do not crank the engine continuously for more than 20 seconds. The battery may be discharged.
Use a fully-charged battery.

test2.ptxt: When the engine can be started, proceed to the next step.
If the engine cannot be started, bleed the air again using the hand pump until the hand pump resistance increases. Then start the engine.

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Start the engine. (*A)
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Test the Fuel Leak. (*B)
Perform the following test 5 times with on/off intervals of 10 seconds: Active Test / Test the Fuel Leak. (*C)

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Allow the engine to idle for 3 minutes or more after performing the Active Test for the fifth time. (*D)
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read Current DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test2.ptxt: When no DTCs are output, the air bleeding is completed.
If any DTCs are output, proceed to the next step.

test1.ptxt: Repeat steps (*A) to (*D).
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and warm it up.
Confirm that the shift lever is in neutral and securely apply the parking brake.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it. (*E)
Rev the engine to 3000 rpm and fully release the accelerator pedal immediately after the engine reaches 3000 rpm. (*F)
Repeat procedures (*E) and (*F) 5 times.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read Current DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

action.actiontitle: DTC CAUSED BY RUNNING OUT OF FUEL

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FREEZE FRAME DATA (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8)

test1.ptxt: Read the value of Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 in the freeze frame data recorded in Procedure 2.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is 5 mm3/st in at least 1 set of freeze frame data

atten4.ptxt: When there is a problem with the operation of an fuel injector due to foreign matter in the inside of the fuel injector, etc., the fuel injection volume decreases. As a result, the ECM gives instructions to increase the fuel injection volume, which causes Injection Feedback Val to increase.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (COMMON RAIL PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Common Rail Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Start the engine.
Read the value of Common Rail Pressure while cranking and idling the engine.

entry.ptxt: The engine cannot be started or the engine can be started but Common Rail Pressure is below 20000 kPa 2 seconds after the starter signal changes from OFF to ON

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the values.

atten4.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off, the engine coolant temperature should be 75째C (167째F) or higher and the engine should be idled for 1 minute or more.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than 3 mm3/st and engine vibration is abnormally large

item.ptxt: When there is a problem with the operation of an fuel injector due to foreign matter in the inside of the fuel injector, etc., the fuel injection volume decreases. As a result, the ECM gives instructions to increase the fuel injection volume, which causes Injection Feedback Val to increase.

The ECM controls the system so that the sum of Injection Feedback Val for all of the cylinders is approximately 0 mm3/st. Even if the value of Injection Feedback Val for a cylinder is less than -3.0 mm3/st (-3.0 mm3/st is the lowest normal value), as long as the value of Injection Feedback Val for each of the other cylinders is 3.0 mm3/st or less, the injector assemblies are not malfunctioning.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ENGINE SPEED

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and drive the vehicle until the engine coolant temperature reaches 75째C (167째F) or higher.
Stop the vehicle and allow the engine to idle.
While checking the tachometer, fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it.*1
Repeat procedure *1 5 times.

entry.ptxt: No problems such as sluggishness or variations in the tachometer reading

testgrp.testtitle: CLEAN FUEL FILTER CASE AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ELEMENT ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Clean the fuel filter case and replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to clean the inside of the fuel filter case as the injector assemblies may not operate properly if the fuel filter element assembly is installed with foreign matter remaining inside the fuel filter case.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (TEST THE FUEL LEAK)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Test the Fuel Leak / Data List / Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot with the GTS during the Active Test.
Measure the difference between the target fuel pressure (Target Common Rail Pressure) and the actual fuel pressure (Common Rail Pressure) when the "Test the Fuel Leak" Active Test is performed.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: In order to obtain an exact measurement, perform the Active Test 5 times and measure the difference once each time the Active Test is performed.

specitem.ptxt: The difference between the target fuel pressure and the actual fuel pressure 2 seconds after the Active Test starts is less than 10000 kPa.

item.ptxt: "Target Common Rail Pressure" is the target fuel pressure controlled by the ECM.
"Common Rail Pressure" is the actual fuel pressure.

entry.ptxt: The difference between the target fuel pressure and the actual fuel pressure 2 seconds after the Active Test starts is less than 10000 kPa

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (CONTROL THE SELECT CYLINDER FUEL CUT)

atten4.ptxt: Use this Active Test to determine the malfunctioning cylinder.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

app-param-unit.app-param: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

item.ptxt: If the engine idle speed does not change when an fuel injector is disabled, the cylinder being tested is malfunctioning. Record any malfunctioning cylinders.
If the cylinder being tested is normal, there will be a significant change in idle speed when the fuel injection is stopped for that cylinder.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT FUEL INJECTOR (INSPECTION FOR VALVE CLOSING PROBLEM)

test1.ptxt: Remove the glow plug for all the cylinders.
Click here
Visually check if there is fuel on the glow plugs.

item.ptxt: If there is fuel on a glow plug, fuel may be leaking from an fuel injector.
After replacing an fuel injector, make sure that the common rail pressure (fuel pressure) is within 5000 kPa (51.0 kgf/cm2, 725 psi) of the target fuel pressure while cranking the engine.

If there is fuel on a glow plug, fuel may have mixed with the engine oil. Check the engine oil amount and whether the engine oil smells of diesel fuel. If the oil level is above the full line or the engine oil smells of diesel fuel, replace the engine oil.

test1.ptxt: Install the glow plug.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector of the malfunctioning cylinder.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the Repair Manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: REGISTER INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE AND PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation code.
Click here
Perform the injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (ENGINE SPEED)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Engine Speed.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the value while cranking and idling the engine.

atten4.ptxt: The value should be the same as the actual engine speed and displayed with no interruption on the GTS.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WIRE HARNESS (FUEL PRESSURE SENSOR AND ECM)

atten4.ptxt: If the MIL has illuminated before in the past, clear the DTC using the GTS before performing this inspection.

test1.ptxt: Check if the MIL lights up when vibration is applied to the wire harness and connectors between the fuel pressure sensor and ECM.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Data List / Fuel Temperature.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the value.

specitem.ptxt: The value is almost the same as the actual fuel temperature.

item.ptxt: When the engine is stopped and left overnight, the fuel temperature becomes the same as the ambient temperature.
If there is a problem with the fuel temperature sensor, and a fuel temperature value lower than the actual fuel temperature is indicated, P0093 may be stored.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR INTERMITTENT PROBLEMS

test1.ptxt: Check for intermittent problems.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WHETHER DTC OUTPUT RECURS (DTC P0093)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Start the engine.
Warm up the engine (engine coolant temperature is 75째C (167째F) or higher).
Confirm that the shift lever is in neutral and securely apply the parking brake.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it. (*A)
Rev the engine to 3000 rpm and fully release the accelerator pedal immediately after the engine reaches 3000 rpm. (*B)
Repeat procedures (*A) and (*B) 5 times.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes
Read the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel temperature sensor.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: Before replacing the fuel temperature sensor, perform a wire harness inspection and if there are any problems with the wire harness, repair or replace it.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR (ECM - FUEL PRESSURE SENSOR)

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the harness or connector.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WIRE HARNESS (FUEL PRESSURE SENSOR AND ECM)

atten4.ptxt: If the MIL has illuminated before in the past, clear the DTC using the GTS before performing this inspection.

test1.ptxt: Check if the MIL lights up when vibration is applied to the wire harness and connectors between the fuel pressure sensor and ECM.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE COMMON RAIL ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the common rail assembly.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: Before replacing the common rail assembly, perform a wire harness inspection and if there are any problems with the wire harness, repair or replace it.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE CRANKSHAFT POSITION SENSOR

test1.ptxt: Replace the crankshaft position sensor.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: Before replacing the crankshaft position sensor, perform a wire harness inspection and if there are any problems with the wire harness, repair or replace it.
